description:
A social game called The Magical Girl Raising Project allows one in tens of thousands of people to be a "magical girl" — possessing extraordinary physical capabilities and looks, as well as special magical powers that set them apart from the rest of the human race. But one day, in a district containing 16 magical girls, the administration announces that it must halve the number of magical girls to solve the problem of magical energy.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

title.native: 魔法少女育成計画 restart

name.native: 森の音楽家クラムベリー

node.description:
Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

__Height:__ 162 cm (5'4")

[Profile](http://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/715/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/numakura_manami) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nu_manami/) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/mnm_n_/) 

A voice actor affiliated with Arts Vision. She is married to fellow seiyuu [Ryouta Oosaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110743) as of October 23, 2019.

[Official Website](https://nanonano.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanonano_me?s=20&t=4VTA1umvQXVSsyul5mYvQg) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/officialnanoTV) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nanonano_me/?hl=ja)


nano is a female singer/song writer on NicoNicoDouga who covers Vocaloid and non-Vocaloid songs in Japanese and English. She has participated in many translations and collaborations because of fluency. nano moved back to Japan during middle school. This is where the “帰国子女” in one of his or her video titles comes from. Kikokushijo means “one who has returned to their homeland”.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/真木太郎)

Tarou Maki is a producer. He graduated from the Department of Law at Waseda University in 1977 and joined Pioneer. In 1997 he founded production studio [Genco](https://anilist.co/studio/79/) and serves today still as its president.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
A former Studio Easter employee. Debuted as an art director on [Guin Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/5041/).
